runs.comm: a beauty to start with, a slower ball which completely foxes Gibbs, cutting back on him and doing him like the proverbial kipper
another ripper, this time swinging away from Gibbs who plays and misses
eat that! What a ball from Taylor, angling into his legs but swinging away at the last moment and it crashes into his stumps. An absolute corker
bang! Straight down the ground. Admittedly, it was a full toss, but he wanged it down the ground
edged, and four! He came forward, tentatively, the ball took a thick outside edge but flew down to the third man boundary
a loose ball down the leg side and rightly wided
classily angled down to third man, coming forward before opening the blade
excellent start, right on the off stump with a hint of movement away from the right hander
quick, and too quick for de Villiers who's hit on the thigh pad. Smith demands him through for a single
awful delivery. Miles wide and rightly wided
too short, Smith's off the mark with a punch into the covers
wide of the off stump, swinging wider
ooh, close; he was going to leave it but patted it out to the off side
miles wide and Smith nearly drags this on
nudged off his legs for two
and another one for Taylor! Horrid, ugly stroke from Smith who tried to work it through the leg side but got a thick inside edge onto his stumps
swinging into his pads, flicked to leg
too straight, he works it through the on-side with a casual flick of the wrists
too wide. Left alone
classily driven off his toes but straight to midwicket
square driven nicely but again he can't find the gap on the boundary
a crunching drive off the back foot - my word, he timed the socks off that - but there's a sweeper out on the deep extra cover boundary
good line, just outside off which cuts back into him and he defends
guided out to point off the back foot
pushed to mid-off
a ferocious swing, trying to launch it into orbit, but he gets a thick inside edge
that's a heck of a stroke. It was too short and much too wide, so Duminy rocked back and uppercut it wide of third man. Top uppercutting; poor bowling
nice bit of nibble, but he turns it to leg
goddim! A lovely slower ball which he drives it, taking a thin outside edge and up goes the keeper...but Rudi turns it down!
flicked to mid-on
driven off a thick outside edge. Perfectly safe though
filthy delivery, miles too wide of the off stump and rightly wided by the umpire
pushed out to the off side off the front foot
firmly defended on the front foot. Good end to a mixed bag of an over
short, cut and an excellent stop by backward point
clattered off the front foot, in the air, but it falls safely in the deep
short, down the leg side and he goes on the hook, not really timing it. It goes high and handsome and just falls short of the rope, going for four
he tries to clatter this through the leg side and is nearly bowled as the ball nearly fizzed back onto his stumps
cracking cut stroke but Smith pulls off a fine stop in the deep
goddim! A loose stroke, slipping it straight to square leg. He just didn't get on top of it
defended out to the off side
defended
a slower ball, Ontong's off the mark with a calm push out to the off side
fine shot - that really is a corker from de Villiers. A thumping, classical cover drive
defended off the back foot but not solidly enough, and the ball is deadened by his feet...nearly rolling back onto his stumps
top shot once again. A tennis-style swat of a pull through midwicket for four. He really slapped it
Ontong nudges to leg for a single - in fact, for two. Excellent running. But no, there's more than two - there's three! Smith makes a hilarious fumble out in the deep, and Sammy is deeply unimpressed
good ball, outside off and punched out to cover
gone! A fine, alert catch from Ramdin, standing up to the stumps, as de Villiers tries to run this slower ball past his gloves...but instead, he edged it straight to him
cracked through midwicket with cracking power
slower ball which he misreads
neatly timed out to the off side, and Ontong somehow manages to steal two. He is seriously quick
attempts to turn this to leg but misses
ooh well bowled, cutting this back into the right hander. Plenty of movement
nudged to leg - Rampaul is lightning quick to dive to his right and save the single
steered to backward point
again rapped on the pads playing off the back foot
firmly blocked out on the front foot
Ontong angles this down to third man
what fielding! It was firmly clipped to his right and Sammy threw himself across the pitch to save a run
pulled, but again only for a single
swung through the midwicket region
dropped out to the off side. Boucher wants a single but has to scamper back
defended off the back fooot
wide enough to be nudged down to third man. Plays that stroke well
down the leg side
punched to leg with the angle, but he can't find the gap
really well bowled - a slower ball which he completely misreads, playing it miles too early and he's hit on the bicep
oh he's hit this inside out, a "pushy", mistimed sort of stroke which nevertheless sails over mid-off
wide, he cuts, he misses
banged to mid-off
too short, he swings it through midwicket  but again can't time it
good catch, Bravo! Fine catch at a wideish mid-on, diving forward as Ontong tries to whip this through the leg side but can't time it
neatly guided out to point
punched out to the off side
nudged back to Sammy who ends his fine spell with 3 for 21 from his four overs
good line to begin with, and Boucher cracks it off the back foot
too short, he pulls it through midwicket but there are two men out on the boundary. But no! They both dive in front of it, like swans on a frozen lake, and let it through for four. Comical
pushed out to the off side
Pollock's driving to long-on and they are sprinting two. Superb running
top class from Pollock, sitting on the back foot and waiting...before deftly dabbing it down to third man
a little fuller, but he finds point with another deft pat
too short, dabbed down to third man
flicked to mid-on
immense spin but it's too short and down the leg side
firmly worked to short midwicket

Lewis has plucked a blinder! Boucher pulled this full toss but was never in control of the stroke, skying it, and Lewis sprinted around the boundary, dived with an outstretched right hand and plucked it safely. A really fine catch
nurdled out to the off side
short, wide, clattered off the back foot
full toss which he flicks to mid-on
outside off, Pollock waits for it and angles it out to deep point
poor ball and Pollock makes him pay, seizing on this short ball and pulling it around the corner for four
good line and length, restricting Pollock to a zero
wide of the off stump, patted down to third man
turning back into the right hander who drops it out to the off side
a push out to mid-off
short, wide of the off stump - Pollock drops it out to the off side for another single
full, straight and defended
cracked out to deep extra cover but...only for a single
padded away
very full, swinging back into Morkel who jabs it out to point
slashed to point and they jog a single...and he should be run out here, but the throw's wide! Not the best of throws from Chanderpaul
wow - he has hit that with tremendous power. What timing too. Nothing more than a pick-up off his legs and it sailed for six
just on his off stump, he angles it down to third man
Pollock skips down the pitch before flicking it through midwicket for two
he hits this down the ground but doesn't really commit to the stroke. It's a limp, indecisive punch over the top
full toss, slapped square of the wicket but only for a single
superb ball, swinging into Pollock who can only jab this out, off the toe-end of the bat, and run a single. Excellent bowling, it really is
smacked down the ground. A full toss, slapped to long-on
it's all going off. Chaos and disharmony rule. A full toss, zeroing in on his pads, they steal a single and Edwards falls over, as does Morkel
what a shot that is! A remarkable short-arm punch, over the top, for six. It was nothing more than a short-arm pick-up
well bowled - much fuller this time and he can't make any of it
pang! That's out the ground. Too straight, Pollock plants his front foot and dispatches it over square leg for six
this is huge! Straight down the ground from Pollock, just easing it over the bowler's head. The crowd strain their necks as they watch it sail over their heads
calmly guided out to backward point
loose stroke from Morkel, trying to clatter one over midwicket but it was too fast and full
too short, cut behind square for four. Just too short and wide, and he played it really calmly
mowed into the deep
swing and a miss from Morkel! Not close to bowling him there, either
uppercut down to third man for four and there's the game for South Africa
